event.title: built a north-south line through what is now

data.event: The Fort Smith and Southern Railway built a north-south line through what is now Le Flore County in 1896.

event.title: built an east-west line the following year

data.event: The Midland Valley Railroad built an east-west line the following year.
A post office established in the community was named "Rock Island" by the U. S. Post Office Department, and the town was renamed in 1905.
Rock Island started the process of incorporation in 1989, but the County Commissioners did not approve the incorporation until 2004.

event.title: did not approve the incorporation until 2004

data.event: Rock Island started the process of incorporation in 1989, but the County Commissioners did not approve the incorporation until 2004.
